definitions: To make or declare sacred; dedicate formally to a religious or divine purpose.
To dedicate (something, especially a church) to God or a religious or divine purpose by a religious ceremony.
To ordain (someone) to a sacred office, especially that of bishop.
examples: The bishop will consecrate the new church next month.
They decided to consecrate their lives to helping the poor.
The ceremony will consecrate the ground as a holy site.
